intro: Zexmenia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan zexmenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
